Happiness is you feel happy inside your heart

True happiness isnâ€™t about holding back or denying emotions; it involves emotional healing. It means acknowledging all our feelings: joy, sadness, anger, & fear & understanding that experiencing a full range of emotions is a natural part of being human. By feeling & processing these emotions, we create space for healing & growth. Honoring our feelings instead of pushing them away strengthens our connection with ourselves, clarifies our needs & boundaries, & builds resilience, helping us face challenges with compassion rather than bottling up emotions.
Itâ€™s okay to seek support when needed. 

Practices like journaling, mindfulness, or therapy help us process, release, & heal emotionally. Nurture your emotional self with compassion. True well-being doesnâ€™t require perfection or the absence of struggle, but a gentle acceptance of all that you are. By feeling, processing, releasing, & accepting all your feelings, you create a balanced life being true to who you really are & your true self, where happiness grows naturally from healing & self-understanding.

However happiness is for the rich people who lead a luxurious life.
Sadness is totally for the poor and needy people who suffer from starvation.

ğŸ’ Smiles:  In the past years,  smiles were treated like the blooming blossoms.  Today, smiles are not pretty as in the past because it has toxic included. 
ğŸ’ Legal earnings:  Those who earn legally are the people who always fall into losses and frustrations in life.  Moreover,  they get punishments for their good acts. 
ğŸ’ Illegal earners: They are the people who always ascend in life.  They never face losses,  failure and difficulties in life. Moreover,  their life will be an enjoyable one. 
ğŸ’ Good hearts and minds: These people oftenly face endless difficulties and disasters in their life. They will never be able to come forward in life.  They are always  punished for their good intentions. 
ğŸ’ Toxic minds and negative thinking people: These people never fall into trouble.  They will never get punishments or pains or even any trouble. They will have a nice and an enjoyable life. Dirty hearts are always benefitted. 
ğŸ’ Good intentions: If you are with good intentions,  you will get destroyed, you will get pains,  you will get punishments,  you will never be able to lead a happy and a peaceful life. There is no value for good intentions. 
By: Dawood âœ
Date: 5th April 2022

Subject: A good person is a gifted person ğŸ’
ğŸ’ God loves doing good things in life. Good things like giving charity,  speaking the truth,  legal earnings,  helping the others,  going in the right way,  maintaining silence,  and carrying out many other good examples in life. 
ğŸ’ Today if a person follows the correct path in life,  then surely all what they will face is frustrations and disasters. This world will never respect a good person,  this world will never care a good person,  this world will never remember the good things done by a good person. 
If I say 'this world' means,  it's the people of this world. 
Remember,  there is no value,  no space,  no respect,  and no reputations for a good person who goes in the right path. 
ğŸ’ A good person's only gift from the toxic people are unkindness,  disrespecting and many other bad things.  A good person falls down into trouble each and every moment they do good things in their life.
ğŸ’ A good person will always have good feelings,  good thinking,  good intentions,  good habits,  good character,  good attitudes and good thoughts towards others. But those good habits becomes pointless to others and in no time it may turn into a massive disaster. 
ğŸ’ A good person will not have the following:-
ğŸ Jealously feelings 
ğŸ Negative thinking 
ğŸ Bad thoughts 
ğŸ illegal earnings 
ğŸ Gossip talking 
ğŸ Toxic attitudes 
ğŸ Bad character
ğŸ’ So, all in all,  a good person will never have a place in this world for  their pure hearts and good minds. They will survive their life by facing lots of frustrations and disasters. 
Their good things will never work.  Their innocent behaviour will be of no use.  Their minds and hearts can be good and pure but it will never bring any benefits to this world. 
ğŸ’ Remember,  there is a value for Gold and diamonds,  there is a value for money, there is a value for luxury homes,  there is a value for expensive property, there is also value for the Toxic people, 
But from the human nature, 
There is no value for a good  person, 
Who has a pure heart and a good mind.  
ğŸ’ Finally, good people with good things goes to  GOD, and that will be their final destination. 
God is always with the good people. 
Good peoples remains GIFTED. 
By: Dawood âœ
Written on: 8th March 2022

All of these comments saying that they just said "be funny" are either disingenuous or just flat-out dumb. The clip said that instead of just answering a question, you should PAINT A PICTURE by making an outlandish situation your answer. That's the tip. It's a frame on which to think of how to answer and make people laugh. 

Instead of saying, "I have always been a fan of Denzel Washington, so working with him was a great experience," which is straightforward but not fun, he PAINTED A PICTURE with his words by telling a story of Denzel coming to his trailer to practice lines while he ripped down his Denzel poster (which didn't happen). This conveys the point that he is a fan, but by using IMAGERY, he made it fun.

Iâ€™ll reply with something like; â€œIâ€™m doing great yâ€™know itâ€™s like when I get a burrito from Taco Bell. Iâ€™m doing pretty great now eating it up and then later tonight I probably will be feeling like Iâ€™ve had a cow on the toilet, just like how Iâ€™d have a cow on the toilet when I eat my Taco Bell.â€ 

Straight up itâ€™s pretty easy to make a reference and use quick thinking you just have to train your brain. Iâ€™ve been this way since I was a child though. People always say I have a potty mouth or Iâ€™m a wee bit snarky and quick witted. 

As a kid, I didnâ€™t have confidence to say stuff to strangers, but I acted that way with my family a lot of the time and throughout the years Iâ€™ve only grown bolder and eventually by high school I started coming out of my shell more I also began referencing things because even as a kid, I thought it was funny to make references and over the years Iâ€™ve educated myself on life  subconsciously much like everyone and now as an adult this kind of thing or this form of humor comes naturally to me and when people respond in references, I understand exactly what theyâ€™re saying and what they mean. Itâ€™s not just comedy itâ€™s a form of speech and dialect and body language and how a person is raised truthfully. 

Itâ€™s not about being like Ryan or following some trendy path or whatever itâ€™s just the environment you surround yourself with and grew up on and people like me and people like Ryan grew up around reference humor. Itâ€™s not a common form of humor compared to dark humor. 

As for me I grew up on reference humor subconsciously because of my thirst for knowledge and also being surrounded by the internet I picked up a few comparison habits. I donâ€™t know for sure on Ryanâ€™s situation but like me it does come naturally to him and it could be how he was raised or self taught. You can teach yourself these referencing habits but itâ€™s not as easy as growing up around it. 

I was raised off making references because I had two working parents, I was bullied in school and it got to a point where the TV and the fictional fantasy books were my best friends and a way to entertain myself was talking to my pets and trying to impress them with my sense of humor and knowledge. (It failed every time, even now) 

Point being there is no secret to what Ryan does. Itâ€™s pretty easy. You just have to teach your brain how to think like that or if youâ€™re like me, then you already know how to do it because you were raised off that kind of language. In a way reference humor is a form of language and it can be spoken in any language, but itâ€™s a form of social language amongst people.

To loosely quote the director of Finding Nemo: "Don't tell your audience 4. Tell them 2+2 and let them figure the rest out for themselves." He was talking about filmmaking but I think also applies to this specific brand of wit.
In the Denzel Washington example, by saying he has Denzel Washington posters, he's giving the audience the first 2. The audience understand the tacit reason for having a poster and that's the +2 they add to it. And 4 is much funnier because it wasn't just said point blank.
Imagine if he did the poster joke but he says it more like "I love Denzel Washington so much I have posters of him" that's giving the audience 4 and telling them why it's funny, rather than letting them put the joke together in their head

Haven't found one im not good with, but my buddy, excellent with quick witty and political, but horrible with dry and sarcastic.
